p: Feeding preference in Ae. aegypti mosquitoes has an underlying genetic basis [ 41, 42], with the Ae. aegypti aegypti subspecies reportedly being more anthropophilic, whereas the sister taxon, Ae. aegypti formosus, is more zoophilic [ 42]. Thus, the low human blood feeding rates observed for the Ae. aegypti population in Kisumu may be indicative of a more zoophilic vector population composition, possibly explaining why the city is less affected by dengue.
